DataElement.preferredName: Pediatric Quality of Life Inventory-Multidimensional Fatigue SRF1 Past One Month Quantity Problem Sleep a Lot Score 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation of how much of a problem it has been in the past one month with sleeping a lot, using a 5 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Pediatric Quality of Life Inventory-Multidimensional Fatigue Scale Past 30 Days Quantity Problem Sleep a Lot Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An 18 item component of the Pediatric Quality of Life Inventory is a generic symptom-specific instrument to measure fatigue in pediatric patients ages 2?18 comprised of General Fatigue, Sleep/Rest Fatigue, and Cognitive Fatigue domains._A period of time consisting of the 30 days before the present._How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number._A difficulty, disorder, or condition needing resolution._A question about whether an individual sleeps or slept a lot._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Pediatric Quality of Life Inventory-Multidimensional Fatigue Scale
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An 18 item component of the Pediatric Quality of Life Inventory is a generic symptom-specific instrument to measure fatigue in pediatric patients ages 2â€“18 comprised of General Fatigue, Sleep/Rest Fatigue, and Cognitive Fatigue domains.

Concepts.longName: Pediatric Quality of Life Inventory-Multidimensional Fatigue Scale
Concepts.definition: An 18 item component of the Pediatric Quality of Life Inventory is a generic symptom-specific instrument to measure fatigue in pediatric patients ages 2-18 comprised of General Fatigue, Sleep/Rest Fatigue, and Cognitive Fatigue domains.

Property.preferredName: Past 30 Days Quantity Problem Sleep a Lot Score
Property.preferredDefinition: A period of time consisting of the 30 days before the present.:How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number.:A difficulty, disorder, or condition needing resolution.:A question about whether an individual sleeps or slept a lot.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: A period of time consisting of the 30 days before the present.
How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number.
A difficulty, disorder, or condition needing resolution.
A question about whether an individual sleeps or slept a lot.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

DataElementConcept.origin: PedsQL: Pediatric Quality of Life, James W. Varni, Ph.D., 1998

ValueDomain.preferredName: Pediatric Quality of Life Inventory Score 5 Point Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that something happens or happened almost all of the time.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that something happens or happened almost all of the time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer that something occurs frequently.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer that something occurs frequently.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: From time to time, but not continually or always.

Concepts.definition: From time to time, but not continually or always.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Added "Sometimes" to represent the MSAS value domain.ghd.01.27.15

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer that something rarely happens.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer that something rarely happens.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not ever; at no time in the past (or future).

Concepts.definition: Not ever; at no time in the past (or future).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created for COG Rave study AGCT1531

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. In cases where retaining the question set intact to preserve the validity and reliability are not as important as advancing the science, questions may be used individually or in combination with other measure questions.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Scoring Manual Link
ReferenceDocuments.description: The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure.
